Key Findings

  • Smallest budget in East Lancashire: Rossendale's £64M total spend is less than half of Hyndburn's £211M and a fraction of Burnley's £355M
  • 21 shared suppliers: £6.4M flows to companies used by multiple East Lancashire councils — enabling direct price comparisons
  • 4,336% price gap on one supplier: E A Foulds Ltd charges Pendle £7.2K average vs Rossendale £163, though different service scopes likely explain most of the difference
  • Lowest CEO salary: At £113,001, Rossendale's CEO pay is the second-lowest in the comparison group after Ribble Valley

The East Lancashire Spending Landscape

Four neighbouring district councils — Burnley, Hyndburn, Pendle, and Rossendale — serve a combined population of approximately 335,000 across East Lancashire. Despite sharing a geography, economic challenges, and many of the same suppliers, their spending patterns differ dramatically.

Rossendale sits at the bottom of the spending league with £64 million across 42,536 transactions. Burnley leads with £355M (30,580 transactions), followed by Hyndburn at £211M (29,804) and Pendle at £125M (49,741). These differences partly reflect council size but also choices about outsourcing, in-house provision, and service scope.

Shared Suppliers: The Price Comparison Opportunity

The cross-council analysis identified 21 suppliers receiving payments from multiple East Lancashire councils, totalling £6.4 million. These shared relationships create a rare opportunity to compare what different councils pay for similar services.

The most striking example is E A Foulds Ltd, where Pendle pays an average of £7,200 per transaction compared to Rossendale's £163. While this 4,336% gap sounds alarming, it almost certainly reflects different service contracts rather than overcharging — Pendle may commission major works while Rossendale uses the same company for minor maintenance.

More meaningful comparisons emerge from suppliers with similar transaction sizes across councils. These are flagged on the AI DOGE spending tool and represent the strongest leads for identifying potential savings.

Outsourcing Models

The councils take different approaches to service delivery. Burnley and Pendle both outsource revenues, benefits, and council tax to Liberata UK Ltd (£45.4M and £16.7M respectively). Rossendale uses Capita Business Services for similar functions (£5.8M). Hyndburn keeps most services in-house, resulting in higher staff numbers but lower outsourcing costs.

CEO Pay Comparison

Rossendale's CEO salary of £113,001 sits just above the national district median of £108,000 and the East Lancashire average. With a pay ratio of 5.7:1 (CEO to median employee), Rossendale is well within the Hutton Review's recommended maximum of 20:1.

What You Can Do

  • Compare prices directly: Use the cross-council comparison tool to see what each council pays the same suppliers
  • Check other councils: Visit the Burnley, Hyndburn, and Pendle transparency sites for detailed spending data
  • Ask your councillor: Request that the council benchmarks its major contracts against neighbouring authorities
